definition: cavalry/caravan of horses carrying goods
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
squadron/team/group/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: There was cavalry on the Place du Palais-Royal.
The trained horses sashayed to perform.
sentences.chinese: 訓練有素的馬隊斜步行進表演馬戲。

sentences.english: Her mother drove the farm’s four teams of horses.
sentences.chinese: 母親經營着有四隊馬隊的農場。

sentences.english: Horse administration was the basis of cavalry troop.
sentences.chinese: 清代馬政則爲馬隊營制之基礎。

sentences.english: If it were possible, I would like this Roma side to be without him.
sentences.chinese: 如果有可能，我希望這支羅馬隊沒有他。

sentences.english: He had watched the passing of the horses with more sangfroid.
sentences.chinese: 看着遠去的馬隊，他顯得更加鎮定自若。

sentences.english: Thiago Silva accepts he is the successor at AC Milan to club legend Paolo Maldini.
sentences.chinese: 弟媳接受了人們把他當做馬隊的接班人。

definition: night attack
desolate and uninhabited (idiom)
sullen/to scowl miserably
light cavalry/light motorcycle/moped
to transmit an order
to prepare an ambush/to waylay
Lishi district of Lüliang city 呂梁市|吕梁市[Lu:3 liang2 shi4], Shanxi 山西
Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
army camp
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to stand guard/to serve on sentry duty
Lintao county in Dingxi 定西[Ding4 xi1], Gansu
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
